timeline.message:
Fix flaky TestSqlTask#testDynamicFilters

Prevent race condition between dynamic filter
update and task entering FLUSHING state (due to
noMoreSplits set to true)

Remove flaky assertion

Task status future will be immediately
done when final task status is set. Therefore
assertion that status version has changed is
flaky (status version increment is executed
in different thread).

timeline.bodyText:
This was failing with
AssertionError: expected [1] but found [0]

how possible is that we could transition to FINISHED without changing the version field?
what's the mechanics here?
timeline.author: findepi

replies.bodyText:
how possible is that we could transition to FINISHED without changing the version field?
what's the mechanics here?


final task status was set (thread 1)
getTaskInfo returned immediately, which is expected (test thread 2)
assertion fails (test thread 2)
version was bumped (after final task status was set) and notification was sent (thread 1)

Depending when getTaskInfo is called, version might be incremented or not. In both cases future completes, which is correct behavior.
replies.author: sopel39

replies.bodyText: Should "final task status was set" and "version was bumped" be synchronized?
replies.author: findepi

replies.bodyText:
Should "final task status was set" and "version was bumped" be synchronized?

They don't need to be (and they shouldn't as action like "getting final task status" might be long). The only invariant is that status version is incremented eventually after action.
replies.author: sopel39

replies.bodyText: does bumping version involve more than incrementing a number?
replies.author: findepi

replies.bodyText:
There is io.prestosql.execution.SqlTask#notifyStatusChanged, which increments version and triggers current listeners.
It's synchronized so that current listeners list is obtained atomically with version increment.
replies.author: sopel39
